files.description: Markdown template for creating new case studies with explicit sections that require linking each empirical claim to a claim card ID.
Markdown template for individual claim cards containing fields for claim text, scope, evidence type, citations/DOIs/URLs, verification status, and abstention triggers.
JSON schema defining the required fields and allowed values for claim cards and the claim-to-case-study linkage rules.
Package initializer for claim card tooling used to validate and enforce the empirical-claim workflow.
Parser utilities to extract structured fields from claim card markdown and to extract empirical-claim references from case study markdown.
Validator that checks claim card files against the schema and enforces that any new empirical claim in the pilot case study is backed by a valid claim card.
Command-line interface to run validation on the pilot case study and claim cards as a required check in the workflow.
Standalone script wrapper that runs the claim-card validator specifically on the pilot case study paths for easy CI or local execution.
Documentation explaining how to create claim cards, how to reference them from the pilot case study, and how verification status and abstention triggers should be used.

missionDescription: Add CASE_STUDY_TEMPLATE.md (or CLAIM_CARD_TEMPLATE.md) with fields: claim text, scope, evidence type, citations/DOIs/URLs, verification status (unverified/partially/verified), and abstention triggers; require it for any new empirical claim in the pilot case study.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Creates a verification-ready workflow (“Claim Card”) with abstention rules and required inputs, reducing stalls due to missing claim text/DOIs and enabling reliable evidence handling across all resear...
